body:
Now I supported prometheus exporter format, for o11y available, we should deploy prometheus server with oap backend.
Using another o11y tool to observe a o11y tool is little wired, and especially their capability overlaps.

So my plan is fetching current self-metrcs + storage-metrics(es cpu,mem,gc etc) to oap receiver, then use graphql to query
a time series result.



Hongtao Gao

Apache SkyWalking && Apache ShardingSphere
Twitter, @hanahmily

> On Jul 1, 2019, at 4:04 PM, 吴晟 Wu Sheng <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> I think we have metrics for OAP self-observability. Which metrics are you proposing?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were assigned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2977?email_source=notifications&email_token=AAO6UWLF37TTRVNDGJ6TYNTP5G3BZA5CNFSM4H4PYM72YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGODY5KQTY#issuecomment-507160655>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAO6UWLZR323EWB3FDVULPTP5G3BZANCNFSM4H4PYM7Q>.
>
So, you are proposing an ES storage implementation for metrics? and query extension for that?
Do you want to set up a new OAP to do that? Or just using the current OAP to storage and read?
I think we need a `witness class` to set two interceptors for different servlet-api versions.
`webapp` folder is not the issue, the jar is.
6.1.0,thank you for your response
For each version, read document in that tag. Master branch doc is for latest codes.
sorry, i have read zhe doc for index page ,but not for 6.x branch
I guess so. Choose tag, we don't have branch for each version.
i know now ,thank you

> Any update? This is updated 25 days ago. Are we moving this to merge or not?

Because logback printing can't be fetched in the test case, and no one completely tests the MDC mode in the case of logback asynchronous, so it not merge.

> @zhaoyuguang @IanCao What is the status of this PR?

I have completed the integration test and it looks good, is it possible to do CodeReview?
What is log buried point?
You mean the log class name? You could send a pull request to fix this.
In oss project, we are looking forward everyone to take part in.

> 
> 
> You mean the log class name? You could send a pull request to fix this.

Yes.I will fix it
@IanCao    Have you finished your review?
@wayilau and please resolve the conflicts

yes, I intend to extend ES storage to support new metrics that don't belong to OAL.

but current query schema is enough for those metrics, well, I’m going to proposal some new query
for metadata though.

@DavenAaron seems you are finding `apache/skywalking-oap-server`

https://hub.docker.com/r/apache/skywalking-oap-server

```shell
docker pull apache/skywalking-oap-server
```
I  add AsyncAppender demo for print traceId, recheck. Please @wu-sheng
Please be advised, the telemetry is a very basic module, even core depends on it, so you can't call storage module services.
@zhanghao001 Please fix CI.
This plugin breaks e2e?
@kezhenxu94 Please help on the first e2e check failure. :) Interesting
I click the re-run to see what happens.
@asfgit rerun the e2e tests please
/run e2e
/run e2e

Got it. That means if I invoke storage in telemetry, maybe there will be a cycle dependency, right?

So my current idea is to create a new receiver, that pull the metrics from telemetry through local network or api.

Can it work, or not?

I did it

@kezhenxu94 Need your review again and approve(if you think so)
Updating? This PR opened a long time. We need to make sure this faster, rather than endless conflicts.

> Updating? This PR opened a long time. We need to make sure this faster, rather than endless conflicts.

ok, i was working on.

I think that you just shut down the oap-server because `startup.sh` starts two processes(oapService.sh+webappService.sh), so you can try it:
`ps -ef | grep "skywalking-webapp.jar" | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}'| xargs kill -9`
/run e2e

Is https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/pull/71 ready to test? From your screenshot, the client and server side endpoint names are not matched, I think they should. 
Any explanation?

Yes , ready to test. i have give the report there serval days ago. here names is set from the System properties.  there i set in the docker-compose.yml, names is  not the same. it is not an important thing.
The e2e tests failed. @kezhenxu94 @wu-sheng

> yes , ready to test. i have give the report there serval days ago. here names is set from the System properties. there i set in the docker-compose.yml, names is the same. it is not an important thing.

Need more explanation, I am asking about span operation names, not endpoint, sorry.

> > yes , ready to test. i have give the report there serval days ago. here names is set from the System properties. there i set in the docker-compose.yml, names is the same. it is not an important thing.
> 
> Need more explanation, I am asking about span operation names, not endpoint, sorry.

emm, yes ,they are not the same , in the client side i give the uri as the operatename, but int the server side i use the interface class name be the operation name.  as this is a RPC protocol, but i don't know the interface class name in the client side, so use the uri instead. Also in the client side publish a rpc service is a uri like. @wu-sheng

> emm, yes ,they are not the same , in the client side i give the uri as the operatename, but int the server side i use the interface class name be the operation name. as this is a RPC protocol, but i don't know the interface class name in the client side, so use the uri instead. Also in the client side public a rpc service is a uri like.

Then this maybe cause some confusing. I recommend you to use URL as default at server side too and open a config to us.

Take `plugin.springmvc.use_qualified_name_as_endpoint_name` of plugin config as an example, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#table-of-agent-configuration-properties

> > emm, yes ,they are not the same , in the client side i give the uri as the operatename, but int the server side i use the interface class name be the operation name. as this is a RPC protocol, but i don't know the interface class name in the client side, so use the uri instead. Also in the client side public a rpc service is a uri like.
> 
> Then this maybe cause some confusing. I recommend you to use URL as default at server side too and open a config to us.
> 
> Take `plugin.springmvc.use_qualified_name_as_endpoint_name` of plugin config as an example, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#table-of-agent-configuration-properties

ok, i will modify this today.
/rerun e2e

> > > emm, yes ,they are not the same , in the client side i give the uri as the operatename, but int the server side i use the interface class name be the operation name. as this is a RPC protocol, but i don't know the interface class name in the client side, so use the uri instead. Also in the client side public a rpc service is a uri like.

> > 
> > Then this maybe cause some confusing. I recommend you to use URL as default at server side too and open a config to us.
> > Take `plugin.springmvc.use_qualified_name_as_endpoint_name` of plugin config as an example, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#table-of-agent-configuration-properties
> 
> ok, i will modify this today.

@wu-sheng  I found a problem with this way. as i publish only one hessian service is ok when use config the url operation name. Bug when i publish serval hessian svc in an app. How could i give the config value? May be i should add an interceptor to achive this.

> I found a problem with this way. as i publish only one hessian service is ok when use config the url operation name. Bug when i publish serval hessian svc in an app. How could i give the config value? May be i should add an interceptor to achive this.

This is the config about which format of naming are you using. Why it conflicts with how many services do you have?

> > I found a problem with this way. as i publish only one hessian service is ok when use config the url operation name. Bug when i publish serval hessian svc in an app. How could i give the config value? May be i should add an interceptor to achive this.
> 
> This is the config about which format of naming are you using. Why it conflicts with how many services do you have?

sorry , i have a misunderstand.
Does Skywalking 6.2 supported Elasticsearch 7.x  now? @wu-sheng
We have clear documents about version supported
@unhappydepig, Will you submit a pull request to fix this?
As FAQ doc provided, I think installation in Websphere should be fixed.
Login has been removed permanently.
Closing for now. No update and further progress.
No Update.
We have supported the latest shardingsphere 3.x and 4.x

e2e and CI with IT tests have been set up by @kezhenxu94. No need to keep this open.

We keep working on e2e and IT tests.
No feedback and old lib.
Oracle is not going to be supported in an ASF project.
6.x release, no feedback.
Spring Cloud Gateway 2.1.x is already supported.
MySQL SQL parameter collection has been supported in 6.2.0 by @kezhenxu94
@wu-sheng thanks, hhh
No old lib, no update.
No update more than one month, clsoing
No decision made. Closing.
@ascrutae Please try to fix this in this release.

@chenmutime Please try the 6.3.0, which including
1. ElasticSearch storage implementation totally changed, much less ES cluster payload
1. Unexpected TTL payload issue has been fixed.
1. FAQ doc about how to set up several key configurations in ES cluster.
No update in more than one month. Closing.
@ascrutae I think you should fix this in 6.3.0
Merged.
@SummerOfServenteen This makes things hard to locate and fix. I will make this open for one month Max. Look forward you could provide feedback and PR to fix.
@zhaoyuguang If you are trying to do this in 6.3.0, please set the milestone.
@ascrutae Please try based on code fragments? To see whether we could address why?
Close as no update.
/run e2e
Duplicate of #2224

I take a look at your original PR which is different from this one.

The correct approach is to set deadline just before invoking service
method. If we request steaming 10 times, 10 deadlines should be set to each
request.

Your approach was to set deadline at stub initial that is the wrong way of
using deadline

you just follow parts of the documentation, please pull the submodules, and check the docs carefully before submitting an issue next time

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/How-to-build.md#build-from-github

In short it have not been pushed to DockerHub.

Docker image is not a part of Apache Release. I usually push it in a week
after official release.

Please subscribe development mail list then you can get notification when
it's available

On Wed, Jul 3, 2019, 11:01 AM ReiDai <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.
>
>    - Why do you submit this issue?
>    - Question or discussion
>
> ------------------------------
> Question
>
>    - What do you want to know?
>    docker hub images not found
>
> ------------------------------
> Bug
>
